description.value:
Trigger A creature walks onto one of the pits

Effect The triggering creature falls and rolls through several spikes as it slides to the bottom. This inflicts @Damage[5[bludgeoning]] damage from the fall itself down the steep slope (the falling PC can't attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Grab an Edge] due to the lack of defined edges to the pit's walls), but the falling PC must also attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The character avoids all of the spikes and takes no additional damage.

Success The character takes @Damage[(2d10+11)[piercing]] damage from the spikes.

Failure The character takes @Damage[(4d10+22)[piercing]] damage from the spikes.

Critical Failure The character takes @Damage[(4d10+22)[piercing]] damage from the spikes plus @Damage[2d6[bleed]] damage. While the character is taking this bleed damage, they are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Sickened]{Sickened 2} from the pain.

details.description: A 20-foot deep, funnel-shaped pit with dozens of wooden spikes lining its walls.
details.disable: Yanking the cloth away is a simple way to expose the danger to allow someone to merely avoid it by walking around its edges, but it cannot be quickly disabled.
details.reset: Creatures can still fall into the trap once it has been exposed, but the camouflaged cover must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.
